text: The Tarn is a river in southern France, tributary of the Garonne river. The Tarn and Tarn-et-Garonne departments are named after this river. ==Geography== The Tarn river has a length of and a drainage basin with an area of . Its average yearly discharge (volume of water which passes through a section of the river per unit of time) is at Moissac, near the confluence with the Garonne, in the Tarn-et-Garonne department for a period of 57 years. The Tarn flows to the southwest, in general, and passes through the following regions, departments and communes: * Occitanie region ** Lozère: Le Pont-de-Montvert, Sainte-Enimie ** Aveyron: Millau, Saint-Rome-de-Tarn ** Tarn: Albi, Gaillac, Lisle-sur-Tarn, Rabastens, Saint-Sulpice-la-Pointe ** Haute-Garonne: Bessières, Buzet-sur-Tarn, Villemur-sur-Tarn ** Tarn-et-Garonne: Montauban, Lafrançaise, Moissac The Tarn river flows through a total of 104 communes. Finally, it flows, as a right tributary into the Garonne near Moissac, in the Tarn-et-Garonne department, at of altitude. ==Main tributaries== The main tributaries, with a length greater than 25 km, of the Tarn are: Left tributaries: * Tarnon - * Jonte - * Dourbie - * Cernon - * Dourdou de Camarès - * Rance - * Agout - Right tributaries: * Muze - * Alrance - * Tescou - * Aveyron - * Lemboulas - ==Gallery== File:Tarn River (France).jpg|The Tarn near Cocurès, Lozère File:Gorges du Tarn view.jpg|The Gorges of the Tarn river File:Albi castelviel pont vieux.jpg|The Tarn at Albi File:Ambialet vue2.JPG|The Tarn at Ambialet File:FR-82-Montauban10.JPG|Pont Vieux, Montauban ==Related pages== * List of rivers of France == References == ==Other websites== * Banque Hydro - Banque Hydro - Station O5901010 - Le Tarn à Moissac (Synthèse) * Die Cevennen: Der Fluss Tarn und die Gorges du Tarn * Office of Tourisme Gorges du Tarn - Grand Causses - Lozère * River Tarn (and the Tarn ‘Ring’) Category:Rivers of Occitanie
